Class Filter

java.lang.Object
it.disi.unitn.videocreator.filtergraph.filterchain.filters.Filter
Direct Known Subclasses:
A3DScope, AudioFilter, ColorCorrect, Concat, Split, VideoFilter
public abstract class Filter extends Object
This class is the abstract representation of a filter to be added to a filter chain.

    Field
    Description

    l
    The system's Locale.

    options
    The set of options to be used in the filter.

  • Constructor Details

    • Filter

      protected Filter(@NotNull @NotNull String filterName)
      This class's constructor. Constructs a new filter (whether video or audio).
      Parameters:
      filterName - The given filter's name.

  • Method Details

    • addInput

      public void addInput(@NotNull @NotNull String streamName) throws InvalidArgumentException
      Adds an input stream to this filter chain. The given input stream must be expressed without the square brackets around.
      Parameters:
      streamName - The input stream's name
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given argument is null or an empty string

    • addOutput

      public void addOutput(@NotNull @NotNull String streamName) throws InvalidArgumentException
      Adds an output stream to this filter chain. The given output stream must be expressed without the square brackets around.
      Parameters:
      streamName - The output stream's name
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If the given argument is null or an empty string

    • updateMap

      public abstract void updateMap()
      Updates the options for the calling Filter instance.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object

    • setOptionWithCond

      protected void setOptionWithCond(boolean cond, @NotNull @NotNull String oname, @NotNull @NotNull String val) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method allows the program to set the filter's options if the given condition is met.
      Parameters:
      cond - The given condition.
      oname - The given option's name. This value cannot be null or an empty string.
      val - The given option's value. This value cannot be null or an empty string.
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If either the option's name or its value (or both) is null or an empty string

    • setOption

      protected void setOption(@NotNull @NotNull String oname, @NotNull @NotNull String val) throws InvalidArgumentException
      This method allows the program to set the filter's options even without any condition.
      Parameters:
      oname - The given option's name. This value cannot be null or an empty string.
      val - The given option's value. This value cannot be null or an empty string.
      Throws:
      InvalidArgumentException - If either the option's name or its value (or both) is null or an empty string
